_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.  Facility Policy.  The owner, manager, and only employee of Brubaker Fertilizer, Inc. is committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the fire department, Pratt County LEPC, and/or other authorities to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the public and the environment.
2,  Facility Information.  The primary activity of this facility is the distribution of products to farmers.  The fertilizer product, anhydrous ammonia, is received stored and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production.  Anhydrous ammonia is stored in tanks designed for this purpose.
3.  Accidental Release Prevention Program.  The facility follows the provisions of the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia" and our state regulations covering anhydrous ammonia.
4.  Five-Year Accident History.  There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia during tha past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at this facility; nor to our knowledge have there been accidental releases resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage or environmental damage.
5.  Emergency Response Program.  The facility has an emergency action plan, andwill not respond to a major release.If a major release of anhydrous ammonia should occur at this facility, the response action is to vacate the area of the release and call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers
6.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety.  Safety improvement is an ougoing process at this facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the conditions of  of the facility.
